questions.text: A 44-year-old female who is a known case of scleroderma presented with shortness of breath, especially during exercise. She underwent right heart catheterization, and her mean pulmonary artery pressure (mPAP) was 35 mm Hg. Which of the following is true regarding her condition? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: CCBs are the first line in all patients

options.label: C
options.text: Lung transplant is the best treatment if identified early

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Endothelin antagonists improve symptoms

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Endothelin receptor antagonists are effective in improving symptoms and functional status in patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension associated with scleroderma.

questions.text: A 24-year-old male who is a known case of bronchial asthma presented for a routine follow-up. PFT was done earlier—his FEV1 was 70%, which improved to 83% after bronchodilator nebulization. He was already on MDI Albuterol daily. On questioning, it seems like he is being symptomatic for at least 2 times per week and is waking up in the nights due to symptoms at least once per week. On examination, there are scattered rhonchi. What should be done? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Add Fluticasone MDI two times a day

options.label: B
options.text: Shift to MDI Salmeterol two times a day

questions.correct_answer: A. Add Fluticasone MDI two times a day
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Inhaled corticosteroids are the cornerstone of asthma management as they effectively reduce airway inflammation, improve symptoms, and prevent exacerbations. They should be added when asthma symptoms are not controlled by a short-acting beta-agonist alone.

questions.text: Which type of PCR is suitable for identifying multiple causative agents? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Multiplex PCR

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Multiplex PCR is the best choice for identifying multiple causative agents in a single test, making it efficient and comprehensive for diagnosing conditions caused by various pathogens.

questions.text: A 34-year-old woman presents with dysmenorrhea. Laparoscopic finding is as shown. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Endometriosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Endometriosis is characterized by the presence of endometrial-like tissue outside the uterus, commonly forming chocolate cysts in the ovaries, which present as dark, blood-filled cysts on laparoscopic examination.

questions.text: What type of budding is described by a broad base with a small bud coming off of it, often associated with a figure of 8 appearances? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Blastomycosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Blastomycosis is characterized by broad-based budding with a figure of 8 appearances, where the term "Blasto" helps recall the broad base nature of the budding structure.

questions.text: The given image is the logo for which of the following health programs? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) National Leprosy Eradication Program

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The National Leprosy Eradication Program logo symbolizes hope, the curability of leprosy, and the inclusion of cured individuals into society, promoting a stigma-free approach towards the disease.

questions.text: Which of the following is the likely disease looking at the pattern of inheritance as provided in the image? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ X-linked recessive conditions are characterized by affected males and carrier females, as males have only one X chromosome, making them susceptible if the gene is defective.

questions.text: Maternal deaths per 1,00,000 women in the reproductive age group is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Maternal mortality rate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The maternal mortality rate measures the number of maternal deaths per 100,000 women in the reproductive age group, focusing on the general population of women of reproductive age rather than only those who have given birth.
  • ➤ maternal mortality rate

questions.text: The lesion in Broadmann’s area 22 causes: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A lesion in Broadmann’s area 22, known as Wernicke’s area, leads to receptive aphasia, characterized by fluent but nonsensical speech and impaired comprehension.

questions.text: An 18-year-old boy from Rajasthan weighing 50 kg is diagnosed with mixed P. vivax and P. falciparum malaria. What is the appropriate treatment regimen on day 2?

questions.text: A 30-year-old male travels frequently and has food during his travels. He presents to PHC OPD with abdominal pain, fever for 4 days. He has bradycardia too. Test for confirmation of diagnosis: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  A) Blood culture

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For typhoid fever diagnosis in the first week of illness, blood culture is the most appropriate and reliable test.
  • ➤ blood culture
  • ➤ Mnemonic – BASU
  • ➤ Mnemonic – BASU
  • ➤ Blood culture – 1 st week onwards
  • ➤ Antibody test (Widal) – 2 nd week onwards
  • ➤ Stool culture – 3 rd week onwards
  • ➤ Urine culture – 4 th week onwards

questions.text: Which of the following is not true regarding Von Willebrand Disease? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: D
options.text: Type 3 has very low levels of vWF

questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Type 1 Von Willebrand Disease is the mildest and most common form, characterized by a partial quantitative deficiency of von Willebrand factor, while Type 3 is the most severe with very low or absent levels of vWF.

questions.text: A 33-year-old patient presented with chest pain, shortness of breath, and edema. On examination, his pulse was irregularly irregular, his JVP was elevated and showed a prominent ‘Y’ descent. On auscultation, he had a high-pitched diastolic sound. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Constrictive Pericarditis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A prominent ‘Y’ descent in JVP along with a high-pitched diastolic sound (pericardial knock) and symptoms of systemic congestion are hallmark features of constrictive pericarditis.

questions.text: A patient has adult respiratory distress syndrome. Which of the following is the action of IL-8 in the pathogenesis in this patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Neutrophil activation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ IL-8 is a key mediator in ARDS that promotes neutrophil activation, which plays a major role in the amplification of inflammation and lung injury in the disease process.

questions.text: Which of the following is false in patients with thyroid eye disease? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: It can lead to vision loss

options.label: B
options.text: Response to vision symptoms is adjuvant to thyrotoxicosis response

options.label: D
options.text: 10% of euthyroid patients can have eye involvement.

questions.correct_answer: B. Response to vision symptoms is adjuvant to thyrotoxicosis response
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Response to vision symptoms is adjuvant to thyrotoxicosis response

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The treatment of vision symptoms in thyroid eye disease is distinct and not directly tied to the management of thyrotoxicosis, highlighting the need for tailored therapy based on the eye disease severity.

questions.text: Full form of JSSK is? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ JSSK stands for Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram, focusing on the protection and care of both the mother and infant by providing comprehensive healthcare services
  • ➤ mother and infant

questions.text: A patient presented with severe back ache and the following x-ray after an RTA. Diagnose the fracture present. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  B) Chance fracture

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A Chance fracture is a flexion-distraction injury that extends through all three columns of the spine and is commonly seen in patients who experience a sudden forward motion, such as in a seatbelt-related injury during a car accident.

questions.text: An image of a perianal disease is shown. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  A) Fistula in Ano

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fistula in Ano should be considered when there is a history of recurrent swelling, abscess formation, or discharge near the anal verge. It is distinguished from pilonidal sinus by its lower location near the anal canal, as opposed to pilonidal sinuses that occur higher up in the natal cleft.

questions.text: A 14-year-old girl, a victim of rape, presents at 22 weeks for abortion. What advice will you give her? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: MTP cannot be done as she has crossed 20 weeks

options.label: B
options.text: MTP can be done till 24 weeks

options.label: C
options.text: MTP can be done only if the mother's life is at risk

options.label: D
options.text: MTP can only be done if there is a substantial fetal anomaly

questions.correct_answer: B. MTP can be done till 24 weeks
questions.explanation:
Ans.  B)  MTP can be done till 24 weeks

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In India, under the MTP Act of 2021:
  • ➤ In India, under the MTP Act of 2021:

questions.text: A 30-year-old patient presented with fatigue. Labs are as follows - Hb 8 g/dL, WBC 150,000, and platelets 50,000. Examination is significant for hepatosplenomegaly. Bone marrow biopsy is shown. What is the most common karyotypic abnormality? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The most common cytogenetic abnormality in adult acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) is the Philadelphia chromosome, characterized by the t(9;22) translocation leading to the BCR-ABL fusion gene.

questions.text: Which vitamin can be deficient in a patient who has undergone gastrectomy? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Gastrectomy can lead to vitamin B12 deficiency due to the loss of intrinsic factor produced by the stomach's parietal cells, which is essential for B12 absorption in the ileum.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man presented with fatigue and hemoptysis. His current Hb is 8 g/dL (previous Hb 1 week ago was 12 g/dL). His bronchoalveolar lavage is reddish in color, and his serum creatinine was 1.7 mg/dL. Biopsy of the kidney revealed paucity of immune complexes. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Microscopic polyangiitis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Microscopic polyangiitis is an ANCA-associated vasculitis that often presents with a combination of pulmonary hemorrhage and renal involvement, characterized by a paucity of immune complexes on biopsy.

questions.text: A 65-year-old patient presents with symptoms of bone pain, anemia, hypercalcemia, and renal impairment. A bone marrow biopsy confirms the diagnosis of multiple myeloma. The patient is started on a treatment regimen. Which of the following treatments is most likely associated with the reactivation of herpes zoster? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Bortezomib

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bortezomib , a proteasome inhibitor used in the treatment of multiple myeloma, is most likely associated with the reactivation of herpes zoster due to its immunosuppressive properties. This highlights the importance of monitoring patients on such treatments for signs of viral reactivation
  • ➤ Bortezomib

questions.text: A child came with malnutrition and follicular hyperkeratotic skin lesions. There was a deficiency of Vitamin A and Essential Fatty Acids. What is the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Phrynoderma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Phrynoderma is associated with malnutrition and deficiencies in Vitamin A and essential fatty acids, and it presents with follicular hyperkeratotic skin lesions, particularly over the elbows and knees.

questions.text: You are applying a vacuum to deliver a baby in a patient with prolonged 2nd stage. The point at which the vacuum is applied is: (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: 3 cm anterior to the posterior fontanelle

options.label: B
options.text: 6 cm anterior to the posterior fontanelle

options.label: C
options.text: 4 cm anterior to the posterior fontanelle

options.label: D
options.text: Midway between the anterior and posterior fontanelle

questions.correct_answer: A. 3 cm anterior to the posterior fontanelle
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 3 cm anterior to the posterior fontanelle

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The flexion point, located 3 cm anterior to the posterior fontanelle, is the optimal site for applying a vacuum during delivery to achieve the necessary head flexion.

questions.text: What will be the clinical presentation if the nerve passing through the marked region has been injured? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Loss of sensation on forehead and dorsum of nose

options.label: B
options.text: Loss of sensation in jaw area

options.label: C
options.text: Loss of sensation in maxillary area of face

options.label: D
options.text: Loss of sensation in the mucosa of nasopharynx

questions.correct_answer: A. Loss of sensation on forehead and dorsum of nose
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Loss of sensation on forehead and dorsum of nose

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The superior orbital fissure allows the passage of nerves that supply sensation to the forehead and dorsum of the nose, including the frontal nerve, whose injury leads to sensory loss in these regions.

questions.text: Drug contraindicated in asthma in PPH (Postpartum Hemorrhage) case? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Carboprost

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Carboprost (PGF2 alpha) is contraindicated in patients with asthma due to its bronchoconstrictive effects.

questions.text: During a health education session, people cannot understand your few technical words during the chat, and it’s a miscommunication. This is which type of barrier? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Semantic barrier

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A semantic barrier occurs when the use of complex language, technical terms, or unfamiliar words leads to misunderstanding and miscommunication.

questions.text: In a patient on mechanical ventilation and placed in prone position which of the following about PEEP is true? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Prevents atelectasis of lung and alveolar collapse

options.label: D
options.text: Increases venous return and thus maintains cardiac output

questions.correct_answer: A. Prevents atelectasis of lung and alveolar collapse
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Prevents atelectasis of lung and alveolar collapse

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ PEEP is primarily used to prevent alveolar collapse (atelectasis) and maintain lung recruitment, especially in conditions like ARDS or when the patient is positioned prone during mechanical ventilation.

questions.text: A patient presented to the OPD as a known case of cervical cancer. On further evaluation, the pelvic side wall was found to be involved, and hydronephrosis was also seen. Identify the stage of cervical cancer. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 3B

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Stages of cervical cancer:
  • ➤ Stages of cervical cancer:

questions.text: A 35-year-old patient presented with sudden breathlessness. X-ray of the patient is shown. What is likely to be heard on auscultation? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Absent sounds

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pneumothorax is characterized by absent or reduced breath sounds on the affected side during auscultation due to the collapse of the lung.

questions.text: A patient came to the emergency room with severe pain in the abdomen. Serum triglyceride level was 1500 mg/dL. Identify the defect? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Apo CII

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Type I Hyperlipoproteinemia, presenting with high triglycerides and abdominal pain, is often due to a defect in lipoprotein lipase or its activator, Apo CII.

questions.text: A patient had a pulmonary mass which shows IHC staining with TTF-1 as shown in the image. What is the likely diagnosis in this patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Adenocarcinoma lung

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ TTF-1 is a key immunohistochemical marker that strongly suggests adenocarcinoma of the lung, particularly when observed in a pulmonary mass.

questions.text: Following is the x-ray of an 18-year-old boy who complains of fever, pain in the lower limb, local rise of temperature, and tenderness in the area shown. On investigation, he has increased ESR. What can be the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Ewing's sarcoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ewing’s sarcoma typically presents in the diaphysis of long bones in children and adolescents, with a onion skin periosteal reaction seen on x-ray.

questions.text: Identify the prolapse?(NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Grade 3 prolapse with cystocele

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Grade 3 prolapse extends outside the introitus and can involve cystocele. Differentiating between Grade 3 and Grade 4 requires the thumb-finger approximation test.

questions.text: A 58-year-old man presents to the clinic with a history of unexplained weight loss, hematuria, and a palpable abdominal mass. Imaging studies reveal a large renal mass. A renal biopsy has the following finding. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Chromophobe carcinoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Chromophobe RCC is identified by cells with distinct borders, a plant-like or resinoid nucleus, and a perinuclear halo, distinguishing it from other RCC types.

questions.text: Which of these is true regarding this? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: EMLA means equal mixture of LA

options.label: C
options.text: Methemoglobinemia is a complication of this cream

questions.correct_answer: C. Methemoglobinemia is a complication of this cream
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ EMLA cream can cause methemoglobinemia as a complication, especially when used inappropriately or in large quantities.

questions.text: A 23-year-old male came with complaints of orange hue over the body with hyperkeratotic perifollicular erythematous papules associated with scaling, which started near the face and slowly progressed to involve the entire body. Islands of sparing noted over the body. Palmoplantar keratoderma noted. Histology shows alternating orthokeratosis and parakeratosis. What is the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Pityriasis Rubra Pilaris

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pityriasis Rubra Pilaris is characterized by an orange-red hue with cephalocaudal spread, islands of sparing, palmoplantar keratoderma, and a histological "checkerboard" pattern of alternating orthokeratosis and parakeratosis

questions.text: In a male child having recurrent urinary problems, an imaging as done as shown. What is the management? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Endoscopic Ablation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Endoscopic ablation is the definitive treatment for posterior urethral valves in children, providing direct relief of the obstruction and reducing the risk of renal damage.

questions.text: Following images show the sample collected from a patient complaining of perianal itching. The diagnosis is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Enterobius vermicularis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Enterobius vermicularis is associated with perianal itching and produces characteristic D-shaped eggs.

questions.text: Evaluate the arterial blood gas with the following findings: pH 7.26, PaCO₂ - 16 mm Hg, HCO₃ - 8, Na⁺ 135, Cl⁻ - 108, K⁺ - 4.2. (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Metabolic acidosis with compensatory respiratory alkalosis with high anion gap

options.label: B
options.text: Respiratory acidosis with compensatory metabolic alkalosis with low anion gap

questions.correct_answer: A. Metabolic acidosis with compensatory respiratory alkalosis with high anion gap
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Metabolic acidosis with compensatory respiratory alkalosis with high anion gap

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presence of a low pH, decreased bicarbonate, and decreased PaCO₂ with a calculated high anion gap strongly indicates high anion gap metabolic acidosis with compensatory respiratory alkalosis.

questions.text: A man habitually consumes coffee before bedtime and claims difficulty in sleep during night. What is the role of caffeine in wakefulness? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Blocks adenosine action and causes wakefulness

options.label: B
options.text: Activates locus coeruleus and cause wakefulness

options.label: C
options.text: No role in maintaining wakefulness if taken 1hr before sleep

options.label: D
options.text: Activates histamine release and prevents sleep

questions.correct_answer: A. Blocks adenosine action and causes wakefulness
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Blocks adenosine action and causes wakefulness

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Caffeine promotes wakefulness primarily by blocking adenosine receptors in the brain, thereby preventing the sleep-inducing effects of adenosine.

questions.text: A dead body shows the following finding as in the image. What is the case? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Smothering is characterized by facial injuries resulting from forceful application that obstructs breathing, distinguishing it from neck compression injuries seen in hanging or garrotting.

questions.text: Identify the classification used and grade of the shown injury in a child. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Gartland’s classification Type III

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Gartland classification is specifically used for supracondylar humerus fractures in children, while the Salter-Harris classification is used for growth plate (epiphyseal) fractures.
  • ➤ Gartland classification
  • ➤ Salter-Harris classification
  • ➤ Gartland classification Supracondylar humerus
  • ➤ Gartland classification Supracondylar humerus
  • ➤ Type 1: Undisplaced Type 2: Displaced with posterior hinge intact Type 3a: Displaced fracture with lateral hinge broken (PM) Type 3b: Displaced fracture with medial hinge broken (PL) Type 4: Completely displaced with both anterior and posterior periosteum avulsed (Intra-operative finding)
  • ➤ Type 1: Undisplaced
  • ➤ Type 2: Displaced with posterior hinge intact
  • ➤ Type 3a: Displaced fracture with lateral hinge broken (PM)
  • ➤ Type 3b: Displaced fracture with medial hinge broken (PL)
  • ➤ Type 4: Completely displaced with both anterior and posterior periosteum avulsed (Intra-operative finding)
  • ➤ Salter-Harris classification of epiphyseal injuries
  • ➤ Salter-Harris classification of epiphyseal injuries
  • ➤ Type I: Fracture line is entirely with in Physis causing epiphyseal slip Type II: Fracture line extends from physis into the Metaphysis (Thurston-Holland’s fragment sign) Type III: Fracture line extends from physis into the Epiphysis causing epiphyseal split Type IV: Fracture line extends across the Epiphysis, (articular surface), Physis, and metaphysis Type V: Crush injury of physis with initially normal X-rays
  • ➤ Type I: Fracture line is entirely with in Physis causing epiphyseal slip
  • ➤ Type II: Fracture line extends from physis into the Metaphysis (Thurston-Holland’s fragment sign)
  • ➤ Type III: Fracture line extends from physis into the Epiphysis causing epiphyseal split
  • ➤ Type IV: Fracture line extends across the Epiphysis, (articular surface), Physis, and metaphysis
  • ➤ Type V: Crush injury of physis with initially normal X-rays

questions.text: Arrange the ECGs in order: Atrial flutter, Atrial fibrillation, PSVT, and Ventricular Tachycardia. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Recognize key ECG patterns such as the sawtooth wave for atrial flutter, irregularly irregular rhythm for atrial fibrillation, narrow complex tachycardia for PSVT, and wide QRS complexes for ventricular tachycardia.

questions.text: What is the diagnosis based on the upper GI endoscopy image? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Esophageal varices

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Dilated column of veins in esophagus represent varices.

questions.text: A suspect of sexual assault of 18 years of age claims to be of 16 years. X-rays of which area can confirm the correct age of the suspect? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D)  Knee and wrist

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The ossification of the wrist and knee is a reliable indicator of whether an individual is 18 years old, as both these areas ossify by that age.

questions.text: A 38-year-old patient presents with chest pain and hoarseness of voice for the past month. MRI of the patient is shown. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: B
options.text: Dissecting aneurysm of arch of aorta

questions.correct_answer: A. Saccular aneurysm of aortic arch
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Saccular aneurysm of aortic arch

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A saccular aneurysm of the aortic arch can present with chest pain and hoarseness due to compression of the recurrent laryngeal nerve. Recognition of the aneurysmal sac on imaging is crucial for diagnosis.

questions.text: A mother brought her 14-year-old mentally retarded child with complaints of joint pain and an irresistible urge to bite his fingers and lips. On investigation, his serum uric acid level was found to be elevated. The child is likely suffering from which disorder? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Lesch-Nyhan syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Lesch-Nyhan syndrome is characterized by severe neurological dysfunction, self-mutilating behavior, and elevated uric acid levels due to the complete deficiency of the enzyme HGPRT.

questions.text: In Horner syndrome, ptosis is seen. In this condition, which muscle is implicated? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Muller's muscle

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The mild ptosis seen in Horner syndrome is due to the involvement of the Muller's muscle, which has sympathetic innervation and contributes to a small degree of eyelid elevation.

questions.text: A 54-year-old lady with multiple nasal polyps, rhinosinusitis, and asthma came to the dentist for a procedure. She recently developed an allergic reaction to aspirin that was prescribed after undergoing a dermatologic procedure. Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding her condition? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: She has sensitivity only to aspirin.

options.label: B
options.text: She could have got this reaction with any other COX-1 inhibitors too.

options.label: D
options.text: Aspirin desensitization therapy can be helpful.

questions.correct_answer: A. She has sensitivity only to aspirin.
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ AERD (Aspirin-Exacerbated Respiratory Disease) involves sensitivity to aspirin and other COX-1 inhibitors, leading to increased leukotriene production and symptoms that can be managed with leukotriene receptor antagonists and desensitization therapy.

questions.text: Identify the instrument: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Nasopharyngeal airway

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The nasopharyngeal airway (NPA) is a flexible tube used to secure an airway via the nasal passage, especially in patients who are semi-conscious and have an intact gag reflex.

questions.text: Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment for an overactive bladder in a patient with dementia? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  A) Tolterodine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Tolterodine is an appropriate treatment for overactive bladder, but caution is needed in dementia patients due to its anticholinergic properties, which can potentially worsen cognitive function. When selecting an anticholinergic drug for these patients, those with minimal CNS penetration, like trospium, would be preferable if available.

questions.text: A primigravida presents at 37 weeks. She is a known case of heart disease with a prosthetic valve on warfarin. What is the next best step? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Switch to LMWH

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In pregnant women with prosthetic heart valves on warfarin, switch to low molecular weight heparin (LMWH) at 36 weeks to reduce the risk of complications during delivery, and stop heparin 12-24 hours before planned delivery.

questions.text: A patient of sickle cell anemia developed aplastic crisis after a viral infection. The agent causing it is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Parvovirus B19

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Parvovirus B19 is the primary viral agent responsible for causing aplastic crisis in patients with sickle cell anemia due to its affinity for and destruction of erythroid progenitor cells in the bone marrow.

questions.text: A 7-year-old child presented with fatigue. On examination, there were scattered purpuric rashes, and abdominal examination was notable for cervical lymphadenopathy and hepato-splenomegaly. Lab parameters are shown – Hb 7 g/dL, WBC 50,000, platelets 60,000. What is the treatment? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Prednisolone + Vincristine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The core treatment regimen for ALL includes Prednisolone and Vincristine as part of the induction chemotherapy to induce remission in pediatric patients.

questions.text: A female patient with infertility presented to the clinic and underwent karyotyping. What is the likely diagnosis in the karyotype shown? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Turner syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Turner syndrome is characterized by a 45, XO karyotype, where there is a complete or partial absence of the second X chromosome, leading to infertility, primary amenorrhea, and other characteristic features.

questions.text: Image a of child with an orofacial cleft as shown. When is the first repair done? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) 3 months

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The first repair of cleft lip is typically done at around 3 months of age, following the Millard's Rule of 10, to optimize surgical outcomes and ensure the infant is prepared for the procedure.

questions.text: A 34-year-old patient presents with lethargy and tiredness. On examination, he has hyperpigmentation around the lips. His BP is 90/60 mm Hg and heart rate is 110/min. Labs revealed a Na⁺ of 125 mEq/L and a K⁺ of 5.5 mEq/L. What is the most appropriate treatment? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Primary adrenal insufficiency requires replacement therapy with both glucocorticoids and mineralocorticoids. Hydrocortisone and fludrocortisone are the mainstays of treatment.

questions.text: A 10-year-old male child presented with the following finding. What’s your diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A limbal dermoid is a congenital, benign growth located at the limbus, often containing connective tissue, hair, or teeth remnants, distinguishing it from other ocular lesions.

questions.text: A 40-year-old farmer presented with retro-orbital pain, conjunctival suffusion, night fever and chills, calf tenderness, cervical lymphadenopathy, hypokalemia, and joint pain. What can be the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Leptospirosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Conjunctival suffusion is a distinguishing symptom of Leptospirosis and is not commonly seen in Dengue or other similar infectious conditions.

questions.text: A patient presented with nodular lesions over the body, which are associated with slight anesthesia over the arm in the ulnar nerve distribution. Histopathology is as shown below. Which of the following options is true about this condition? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Lepromatous leprosy with positive Lepromin test

options.label: B
options.text: Tuberculoid leprosy with positive Lepromin test

options.label: C
options.text: Lepromatous leprosy with negative Lepromin test

questions.correct_answer: C. Lepromatous leprosy with negative Lepromin test
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Lepromatous leprosy with negative Lepromin test

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In lepromatous leprosy, due to poor cell-mediated immunity, the Lepromin test is typically negative. This form of leprosy presents with multiple nodular lesions and sensory loss, often in a symmetrical distribution.

questions.text: A young woman presents with weight loss, tachycardia, heat intolerance, and tremors. She has exophthalmos on examination. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Graves' disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Graves' disease should be suspected in patients presenting with symptoms of hyperthyroidism (weight loss, tachycardia, heat intolerance) along with exophthalmos, a distinguishing feature of the condition

questions.text: Identify the sign. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Double ring sign

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The "double ring sign" on an X-ray is characteristic of a button battery, easily distinguishable by its unique appearance.

questions.text: Which is the best stain for biopsy during laryngoscopy for vocal cord examination? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Supravital

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Toluidine blue, a supravital stain, is the best stain for non-invasive detection of cancerous growths during laryngoscopy of the vocal cords due to its high uptake by cells with active DNA and RNA synthesis.
  • ➤ Toluidine blue, a supravital stain, is the best stain for non-invasive detection of cancerous growths during laryngoscopy of the vocal cords

questions.text: Which of the following is an inclusion criterion for the shorter bedaquiline regimen in the treatment of tuberculosis? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: B
options.text: Rifampicin resistance with both KatG and inhA mutation

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Rifampicin-resistant but fluoroquinolone-sensitive TB

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bedaquiline shorter regimen is indicated for the treatment of -
  • ➤ Rifampicin-resistant TB (FQ sensitive) or MDR TB INH Resistant TB – due to mutation in either inhA or Kat G gene (NOT BOTH) Pulmonary TB
  • ➤ Rifampicin-resistant TB (FQ sensitive) or MDR TB
  • ➤ INH Resistant TB – due to mutation in either inhA or Kat G gene (NOT BOTH)
  • ➤ Pulmonary TB

questions.text: The classification shown is for? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  B) Pelvic organ prolapse

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The POP-Q system is a specific and standardized classification method used to quantify and describe the extent of pelvic organ prolapse using detailed anatomical measurements. The hymen is the reference point for this classification.

questions.text: What will be the duration of below-knee POP cast applied for the following injury?(NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 6-8 weeks

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fractures of the metatarsals, including those at the base of the fifth metatarsal, are typically treated with a below-knee plaster cast for a duration of 6-8 weeks to ensure proper healing.
  • ➤ 6-8 weeks

questions.text: In Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus, what is the feature of stage 3 beta cell destruction? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Stage 3 of Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus is characterized by autoimmunity, dysglycemia, and the presence of clinical symptoms, meeting the criteria for diabetes diagnosis.

questions.text: Patient presents with urinary complaints with sterile pyuria on urine-analysis. A cystoscopy shows dilated ureteric orifice. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Golf hole ureteric orifice

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A dilated ureteric orifice seen on cystoscopy in a patient with sterile pyuria is indicative of a golf hole ureteric orifice, a condition where the orifice is abnormally dilated, often due to reflux or functional obstruction.

questions.text: A patient with diarrhoea and skin lesions was advised to change his diet, which resulted in the improvement of his symptoms. Which of the following is the likely antibody present in this patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Anti-TTG antibody is the primary serological marker used in diagnosing celiac disease, particularly when dietary changes lead to symptom improvement.

questions.text: Investigation of choice for JNA? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) CECT

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The investigation of choice for diagnosing Juvenile Nasopharyngeal Angiofibroma is CECT due to its ability to define the tumor's vascularity and extent while safely avoiding the complications associated with biopsy

questions.text: Scenario with primary amenorrhea with secondary sexual characters present, uterus and ovaries present with an image as shown. What is the likely karyotype ? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 46 XX

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Primary amenorrhea with normal development of secondary sexual characteristics and intact internal female reproductive organs (uterus and ovaries) generally indicates a normal female karyotype, 46 XX.

questions.text: Lignocaine is used in a loading dose for the treatment of arrhythmias. The loading dose of this drug depends upon which of the following factors? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Volume of distribution

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The volume of distribution is the key factor that determines the loading dose of a drug, especially in intravenous administration where bioavailability is 100%
  • ➤ volume of distribution

questions.text: A man wears female heels and a female dress to get sexual arousal. He is not interested in males. What is the diagnosis ? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Transvestic Fetishism

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Transvestic Fetishism is characterized by cross-dressing for sexual arousal without any associated desire to change one’s gender or sexual orientation.

questions.text: A traveler consumed oysters. He later presented with bloody diarrhea, abdominal pain, and vomiting. The organism seen on microscopy exhibited Kanagawa phenomenon. The likely causative organism is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Vibrio parahaemolyticus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vibrio parahaemolyticus is the likely cause of gastroenteritis with bloody diarrhea following the consumption of oysters, and it exhibits the Kanagawa phenomenon on microscopy.

questions.text: A woman in her reproductive age presented with a foul-smelling discharge, burning sensation, and lower abdominal pain. She also experiences dysuria. Pap smear is shown below. The organism responsible is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Trichomonas

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Trichomonas vaginalis infection is characterized by a foul-smelling discharge, burning sensation, and the presence of pear-shaped trophozoites on a Pap smear.

questions.text: Which of the following drug used in ADHD is a Selective Norepinephrine Reuptake Inhibitor? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Reboxetine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Reboxetine is a selective norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (NRI) that can be used off-label for ADHD, distinct from other ADHD medications that target both norepinephrine and dopamine or act on other neurotransmitter systems.

questions.text: What instrument is used to insert this tube? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  B) Cysto-Urethroscope

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The insertion of a double J stent in the ureter is performed using a cysto-urethroscope, which allows for direct visualization of the bladder and ureteric orifices, enabling accurate stent placement.

questions.text: A study was undertaken to evaluate the effect of Dietary modification on Serum cholesterol. A group of 100 people were chosen. Their mean cholesterol levels were measured before and after dietary modification. Which statistical test should be applied to test significance? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  C) Paired student’s t-test

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The paired student’s t-test is the appropriate statistical test for comparing means of paired quantitative data collected from the same group before and after an intervention.

questions.text: A young male child presents with failure to pass meconium and has been diagnosed with megacolon. Which of the following layers is affected by the absence of neurons? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 2 and 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hirschsprung disease is characterized by the absence of the submucosal (Meissner's) and myenteric (Auerbach's) plexuses in the submucosa and muscularis propria, leading to functional obstruction and megacolon due to failure of neural crest cell migration.

questions.text: Which tongue papillae do not have taste buds? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Filiform

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The filiform papillae do not contain taste buds and are primarily involved in general sensations like touch and texture, not in the sensation of taste

questions.text: A neonate was brought with complaints of poor feeding, vomiting, acidosis, and cataract. Urine Benedict’s test was positive, while urine glucose was negative. The enzyme defective in this case is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Classical galactosemia is caused by a deficiency of galactose-1-phosphate uridyl transferase, leading to the accumulation of galactose and its metabolites, resulting in serious clinical symptoms including cataracts and liver damage.

questions.text: A patient from a military background presented with rash, fever, and altered sensorium. There is also a deficiency of the membrane attacking complex. The likely cause can be: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Neisseria meningitidis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Patients with deficiencies in the membrane attack complex (C5-C9) of the complement system are particularly susceptible to infections caused by Neisseria species, such as Neisseria meningitidis, which can lead to severe conditions like meningococcemia.

questions.text: Which of the following is correct regarding the treatment of a patient who presented with the following as shown in the image? Earlier the abdominal mass was reducible, but now it has become irreducible. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Umbilical excision with herniorrhaphy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of complicated umbilical hernias, especially when the hernia becomes irreducible, surgical intervention with umbilical excision and herniorrhaphy is necessary to repair the hernia and prevent further complications.

questions.text: A woman suffered from sunburn after enjoying a vacation on a beach. Now while taking a shower lukewarm water (40 degree celsiuis) touches her back causing her to feel pain. What type of receptors are activated by lukewarm water and what causes her to feel pain? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Innocuous thermal receptor - allodynia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Allodynia is a condition where a normally non-painful stimulus, such as lukewarm water, causes pain. This occurs due to the activation of innocuous thermal receptors in the setting of heightened skin sensitivity, such as after a sunburn.
  • ➤ Allodynia

questions.text: A child was born after 8 months of the father’s death. Grandparents filed a case that the baby might not be their son’s, but DNA came positive. What is such a child called? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Posthumous child

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A posthumous child is one born after the death of a parent, as seen in this scenario where the child was born 8 months after the father's death.

questions.text: To study the effect of Vitamin C consumption on the occurrence of Respiratory disease, arrange the steps of a case-control study in sequence. (NEET PG 2024) 1 – Measurement of exposure. 2 – Matching. 3 – Analysis and interpretation. 4 – Selection of cases and controls.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 4-2-1-3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The correct sequence of steps in a case-control study is: Selection of cases and controls, matching, measurement of exposure, and then analysis and interpretation.

questions.text: Fecal discharge from umbilicus occurs in: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Ileal diverticulum

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Meckel's diverticulum, due to its persistence of the vitelline duct, can lead to fecal discharge from the umbilicus, particularly when a fistula is present.

questions.text: A 20-year-old male patient presented with a headache and altered sensorium. MRI was performed, which revealed multiple ring-enhancing lesions. What will be the next step to confirm the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) MR spectroscopy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The presence of multiple ring-enhancing lesions in the basal brain region on MRI suggests tuberculomas, and MR spectroscopy is the preferred next step to confirm the diagnosis by detecting a lipid-lactate peak.

questions.text: A 45-year-old female comes to the OPD with complaints of “feeling tensed” and having “stomach upset” symptoms, including heartburn and diarrhea. She states that she has been having these symptoms since she was 25 years old and that her family members are also usually tense and “nervous.” Which of the following symptoms are also likely to be present in this patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Tingling of extremities

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Patients with Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD) may experience somatic symptoms like tingling of extremities due to heightened anxiety and nervous system activity.

References:

  • ↳ Option B. Ideas of Reference:
  • ↳ Option C. Hallucinations: Hallucinations involve sensory perceptions without external stimuli and are common in psychotic disorders, such as schizophrenia, but not in anxiety disorders.
  • ↳ Option C. Hallucinations:
  • ↳ Option D. Neologisms: Neologisms are newly coined words or phrases that have meaning only to the person using them and are commonly seen in formal thought disorders like schizophrenia. This is not a symptom seen in GAD.
  • ↳ Option D. Neologisms:

questions.text: Police brought a person from the railway track with features of dry mouth, dilated pupil, dry skin, slurring of speech, and delirium. What could be the possible diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Dhatura

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Dhatura poisoning exhibits an anticholinergic toxidrome characterized by dry mouth, dry skin, dilated pupils, and altered mental status, distinguishing it from other toxidromes.

questions.text: If a woman is undergoing MTP after 24 weeks of gestation due to congenital anomaly in the fetus , whose presence is not required for authorization? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Lawyer

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In MTP after 24 weeks for congenital anomalies, the medical board's authorization is required and comprises a gynecologist, pediatrician, and sonologist. A lawyer’s presence is not required for this authorization process.

questions.text: Covering of the omphalocele is derived from: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Amnion

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The outer covering of an omphalocele is derived from the amnion, with the peritoneum lining the inner surface and Wharton’s jelly situated between the

questions.text: While preparing a slide for histopathological examination (HPE), a box-like gross appearance is seen in the scanner view. In which of the following conditions is this seen? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Morphea

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Morphea, a localized form of scleroderma, is identified by a box-like or squared-off appearance on histopathological slides due to marked collagen sclerosis in the dermis.

questions.text: A 34-year-old patient presents with cough and shortness of breath. Subsequent evaluation revealed a diagnosis of COPD, and a chest radiograph was obtained, which showed panacinar emphysema. Which enzyme deficiency is associated with this condition? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency should be suspected in younger patients presenting with emphysema, especially when they have never smoked, have a family history, or present with panacinar emphysema predominantly affecting the lower lobes

questions.text: Examination of suspicious stain shows the image below. Which test is this? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Barberio

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Barberio test is identified by the presence of yellow needle-shaped crystals and is used for detecting spermine and spermidine in semen stains

questions.text: A 26-year-old male presented with colicky pain. Following type of crystals were found on urine examination. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hexagonal cystine crystals in urine are characteristic of cystinuria, a genetic disorder affecting the renal absorption of certain amino acids, leading to recurrent cystine stone formation.

questions.text: Identify the child whose growth is compromised: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Line C

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In pediatric health assessments, growth charts are critical tools. They help healthcare providers monitor a child's growth over time, comparing their progress against standardized percentile curves. A trajectory like "C", which falls below the 3rd percentile, warrants further investigation to determine the cause of the poor growth and to initiate appropriate interventions.

questions.text: A 35-year-old lady presents with sudden severe headache. CT is shown below. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) SAH (Subarachnoid Hemorrhage)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ SAH presents with sudden, severe headache and is identified on CT by hyperdensity in the CSF cisterns. The most common cause is aneurysmal rupture, best evaluated using CT angiography.

questions.text: A patient presents with a lower limb wound as shown. The wound had healthy granulation tissue. What will be used as a cover? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Split thickness skin graft

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Split thickness skin grafts are the best choice for covering large, healthy granulating wounds, particularly in areas where cosmesis is not the primary concern.

questions.text: A 3-month-old baby with intracranial diffuse calcifications, chorioretinitis, and hydrocephalus. What is the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Toxoplasmosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The key fact to memorize is that the triad of intracranial diffuse calcifications, chorioretinitis, and hydrocephalus is indicative of congenital toxoplasmosis.
  • ➤ Remember:
  • ➤ Remember:
  • ➤ Periventricular calcification – Congenital CMV infection Intracranial diffuse calcification - Congenital toxoplasmosis Gray matter-white matter (GMWM) Calcification – Congenital Zika virus
  • ➤ Periventricular calcification – Congenital CMV infection
  • ➤ Intracranial diffuse calcification - Congenital toxoplasmosis
  • ➤ Gray matter-white matter (GMWM) Calcification – Congenital Zika virus

questions.text: A person who chronically consumes alcohol and indulged in binge drinking ten days’ back was brought to the hospital. At the presentation, he was unconscious. His Non-Contrast CT scan was normal. His blood glucose came out to be 49 mg/dL. What treatment should be initiated? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.correct_answer: A. I.m thiamine followed by dextrose
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) I.m thiamine followed by dextrose

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In patients with alcohol dependence presenting with hypoglycemia, always administer thiamine before dextrose to prevent the precipitation of Wernicke's encephalopathy.

questions.text: Identify the implant shown in the image used for treatment of proximal femoral fracture. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Dynamic hip screw

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Dynamic Hip Screw (DHS) is a two-part implant, featuring a screw and a plate, and is used to treat intertrochanteric fractures of the proximal femur.
  • ➤ Dynamic Hip Screw (DHS)

questions.text: On Head impulse test, for a Left vestibular neuritis patient, Saccade will be in which direction? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.correct_answer: C. Right on left head rotation
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Right on left head rotation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In left vestibular neuritis, head impulse tests reveal saccades towards the right when the head is rotated to the left due to the hypoactive left vestibular system.

questions.text: A patient with hypertension and CKD presented with generalized tiredness. ECG is taken and shown. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hyperkalemia is characterized by tall T waves, wide QRS complexes, and absence of P waves on an ECG, indicative of conduction blocks and atrial paralysis.

questions.text: A 43-year-old male presented with right-sided rib pain and shortness of breath. A chest X-ray showed a significant right-sided pneumothorax with cardio-mediastinal shift to the left. Which of the following changes will be seen? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Increased lung volume, Increased thoracic volume

options.label: B
options.text: Decreased lung volume, Increased thoracic volume

options.label: C
options.text: Decreased lung volume, thoracic volume remains unaffected

options.label: D
options.text: Lung volume remains unaffected, Decreased thoracic volume

questions.correct_answer: B. Decreased lung volume, Increased thoracic volume
questions.explanation:
Ans. B)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a pneumothorax, the affected lung collapses leading to decreased lung volume, while the thoracic volume increases due to the loss of negative pleural pressure and the expansion of the thoracic cavity.

questions.text: A young female patient complains of low back pain radiating to the right hip, back of the thigh, leg, and ankle after an intense workout of lifting some heavy weights. MRI shows the following finding. Which nerve root is most likely to be involved here? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) L5

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In an L4-L5 disc prolapse , the L5 nerve root is most commonly compressed, causing pain radiating down the back of the thigh and into the leg and ankle.
  • ➤ L4-L5 disc prolapse
  • ➤ L5 nerve root

questions.text: A child presented with the following deformity and history of recurrent tooth abscess. On lab investigation, his serum calcium was normal, serum phosphorus was normal/reduced, serum PTH was normal, and ALP was increased. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  A)  Hypophosphatemic rickets

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hypophosphatemic rickets is characterized by normal PTH levels, normal/reduced phosphorus levels, and increased alkaline phosphatase (ALP). If PTH is normal in a case of suspected rickets, hypophosphatemic rickets should be strongly considered.
  • ➤ Hypophosphatemic rickets is characterized by normal PTH levels, normal/reduced phosphorus levels, and increased alkaline phosphatase (ALP).

questions.text: Sequence of Rigor Mortis is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Head to foot

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rigor mortis follows a sequence known as Nysten's Rule, developing and passing from head to foot, starting with the upper body and ending with the lower extremities.

questions.text: A patient has mental retardation, seizures, thrombotic state, amino acid metabolism disorder, osteoporosis, and ectopia lentis. Which vitamin must be supplemented to the patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Homocystinuria is characterized by ectopia lentis, thrombotic state, mental retardation, and seizures, among other features. Vitamin B6 supplementation is essential in managing this condition by aiding the function of the deficient enzyme cystathionine beta-synthase.

questions.text: A patient presents with hypertension. He has a history of renal stones and has experienced a few episodes of renal colic. Which diuretic is the most appropriate to use? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Hydrochlorothiazide

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hydrochlorothiazide is the preferred diuretic in patients with a history of renal stones because it reduces urinary calcium excretion, thereby decreasing the risk of stone formation.

questions.text: Sour taste is mediated by:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) TRPV1 Channel

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sour taste is mediated by the activation of ion channels, particularly the TRPV1 channel and acid-sensitive ion channels, in response to H+ ions from acidic substances

questions.text: Desert rheumatism is caused by: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Coccidioides immitis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Desert rheumatism (Valley fever or California fever) is caused by the fungus Coccidioides immitis.

questions.text: After a right limb amputation, the patient is experiencing severe pain (phantom limb). What is the mechanism behind this? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Projection of adjacent fibers to overlap to right sensory cortex

options.label: B
options.text: Projection of adjacent fibers to overlap to left sensory cortex

questions.correct_answer: B. Projection of adjacent fibers to overlap to left sensory cortex
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Projection of adjacent fibers to overlap to left sensory cortex

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cortical plasticity allows adjacent cortical areas to project into regions that have lost their original sensory input, such as after limb amputation. This often leads to phantom limb pain, where the sensation of the missing limb is still perceived.

questions.text: A person reported to OPD alongside his 32-year-old brother working in a factory. The brother was recently subjected to a test – Coproporphyrin in urine. The physician should suspect: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Coproporphyrin in urine is an important screening test for lead poisoning, indicating exposure to lead, and should be followed by diagnostic tests to assess absorption.

questions.text: A 35-year-old male patient presented to OPD with fever and neurological complications. He was having respiratory difficulty during the examination. Identify the disease transmitted through the life cycle shown in the image. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Nipah virus disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Nipah virus is transmitted through contact with Pteropus bats, contaminated food, or animals that have been exposed to the virus. It causes severe respiratory and neurological symptoms with a high fatality rate and no available vaccine.

questions.text: Which disease is represented by the submerged portion of the iceberg in the iceberg model? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Influenza

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The iceberg phenomenon describes diseases with a significant proportion of hidden, asymptomatic, or subclinical cases, such as influenza, which contribute to disease transmission.
  • ➤ Remember – No carriers – No iceberg Phenomena – Measles, Rubella, Rabies, Tetanus and + Pertussis
  • ➤ Remember – No carriers – No iceberg Phenomena – Measles, Rubella, Rabies, Tetanus and + Pertussis

questions.text: An elderly patient underwent investigations which revealed Hb 9 g/dL, TLC 50,000/mm³, ↑PT, ↑aPTT, low platelet count, and increased D-dimers. Which of the following is the likely gene affected in the patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) PML- RARA

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ APL (acute promyelocytic leukemia) is characterized by the PML-RARA fusion gene and is highly associated with DIC, which can be identified by a combination of bleeding tendencies and abnormal coagulation profiles.

questions.text: Which of the following is represented in the below figure by drug X? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Epsilon Amino Caproic acid

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Epsilon Amino Caproic Acid (EACA) is an anti-fibrinolytic drug that inhibits the activation of plasminogen, thereby preventing the breakdown of fibrin and stabilizing blood clots.

questions.text: A 50-year-old female presented with dyspnea and chest pain. Which of the following proves that she has aortic stenosis rather than aortic regurgitation? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Increase in myocardial oxygen consumption is seen with increased pressure work than volume

options.label: B
options.text: Aortic stenosis causes reduced pressure at the aortic valve

options.label: C
options.text: Workload has nothing to do with myocardial oxygen consumption

options.label: D
options.text: Increased pressure - Increase in preload more than afterload

questions.correct_answer: A. Increase in myocardial oxygen consumption is seen with increased pressure work than volume
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Aortic stenosis is characterized by increased pressure work (afterload) leading to higher myocardial oxygen consumption, distinguishing it from aortic regurgitation, which is associated with volume overload (preload).

questions.text: A diabetic patient was advised exercise by the treating physician. The glucose transporter which is insulin sensitive is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Glut 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Glut 4 is the only glucose transporter that is insulin-sensitive, primarily found in adipose tissue, skeletal muscle, and cardiac muscle, where it facilitates glucose uptake in response to insulin.

questions.text: A patient had a cataract surgery 3 years back, now complains of decrease in vision and presented with the following slit lamp image. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Posterior capsular opacification is a common complication after cataract surgery, presenting with gradual vision loss without pain. It is treated with ND laser capsulotomy.

questions.text: A skin rash gets exaggerated on sun exposure is repaired by which mechanism? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Nucleotide excision repair

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Nucleotide excision repair is the primary DNA repair mechanism that corrects damage caused by UV light, such as thymidine dimers.

questions.text: A patient presented with tingling and numbness in the legs, polyuria, and weight loss. He underwent a bone marrow aspirate (image as shown). Which of the following is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.correct_answer: C. Multiple myeloma with renal involvement
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Multiple myeloma is identified by an increase in clonal plasma cells in the bone marrow, accompanied by systemic symptoms such as renal involvement, neuropathy, and weight loss.

questions.text: Which of these is an indication for giving adjuvant radiotherapy in oral malignancy after resection and MRND? (An image of the flap reconstruction was shown). (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Extranodal extension

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Extranodal extension is a key indication for adjuvant radiotherapy in oral malignancy after surgical resection and MRND due to its significant impact on prognosis and risk of recurrence.

questions.text: In the presence of tracheal deviation as indicated on a chest X-ray, which procedure is the most difficult to perform? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Tracheostomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Tracheostomy can be more challenging in cases of tracheal deviation due to the altered position of the trachea, making the precise location for incision difficult to identify.

questions.text: Which of the following is contraindicated in Iron overdose? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) BAL

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ BAL is contraindicated in iron overdose due to its potential to form harmful complexes, making Desferrioxamine the preferred treatment in such cases.

questions.text: A 12-year-old child presented with cervical lymphadenopathy. A biopsy is obtained and it is as shown below. Flow cytometry showed the following findings: Tdt – negative, CD5/CD23 – negative, CD10/CD19/CD20, and SIg are positive. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Burkitt’s lymphoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Burkitt’s lymphoma should be considered in young patients presenting with cervical lymphadenopathy and specific flow cytometry findings including negative Tdt and positive CD10, CD19, CD20, and SIg.

questions.text: Which visual field defect is shown in the image below? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The enlarged blind spots on visual field testing are indicative of conditions like papilledema , where optic disc swelling leads to an increased physiological blind spot
  • ➤ enlarged blind spots on visual field testing are indicative of conditions like papilledema

questions.text: A 32-year-old woman in her second pregnancy is diagnosed with deep vein thrombosis (DVT) at 30 weeks gestation. What is the drug of choice for her treatment? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) LMWH (Low Molecular Weight Heparin)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In pregnancy, the drug of choice for treating DVT is Low Molecular Weight Heparin (LMWH) due to its safety and ease of monitoring compared to other anticoagulants

questions.text: A 45-year-old patient presents with progressive muscle weakness, particularly affecting the eyes and throat, leading to difficulty with swallowing and drooping eyelids. Imaging studies reveal a mediastinal mass. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Thymoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Thymoma is the most common anterior mediastinal mass associated with myasthenia gravis, presenting with symptoms like progressive muscle weakness, difficulty swallowing, and drooping eyelids.

questions.text: In Demographic cycle, B curve represents: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Death rate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The B curve in the demographic cycle represents the death rate, which declines significantly from stage 2 due to improved healthcare and stabilizes in later stages.

questions.text: A 35-year-old patient presented with shortness of breath, and further evaluation revealed a right pleural effusion. Upon analysis, pleural fluid showed LDH that is 0.7 times the serum LDH and protein that is 0.6 times the serum protein. What is the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Tuberculosis

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The pleural fluid values provided are consistent with an exudative effusion based on Light’s criteria:
  • • Light’s Criteria for Exudative Effusion (any one of the following): Pleural fluid protein / serum protein ratio > 0.5 Pleural fluid LDH / serum LDH ratio > 0.6 Pleural fluid LDH > 2/3 the upper limit of normal serum LDH This case satisfies both the first and second criteria: Protein ratio = 0.6 > 0.5 LDH ratio = 0.7 > 0.6
  • • Light’s Criteria for Exudative Effusion (any one of the following):
  • • Pleural fluid protein / serum protein ratio > 0.5
  • • Pleural fluid LDH / serum LDH ratio > 0.6
  • • Pleural fluid LDH > 2/3 the upper limit of normal serum LDH
  • • This case satisfies both the first and second criteria:
  • • Protein ratio = 0.6 > 0.5
  • • LDH ratio = 0.7 > 0.6
  • • Therefore, it is an exudative effusion.
  • • Tuberculosis is a common cause of exudative pleural effusion, especially in endemic areas like India. The effusion is typically lymphocyte predominant and due to pleural inflammation and increased capillary permeability.
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. Heart failure: Commonly causes transudative effusion due to increased hydrostatic pressure.
  • • Option B. Heart failure:
  • • Option C. Hepatic failure: Usually results in transudative effusion, especially in cirrhosis (hepatic hydrothorax), due to low oncotic pressure.
  • • Option C. Hepatic failure:
  • • Option D. Renal failure: Leads to transudative effusion due to fluid overload or low albumin.
  • • Option D. Renal failure:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Tuberculosis causes exudative pleural effusions due to pleural inflammation. In contrast, heart failure, hepatic failure, and renal failure typically cause transudative effusions.

questions.text: A G2 with a previous LSCS underwent cesarean delivery. During surgery, there was excessive bleeding, and a hysterectomy had to be done. The image of the uterus is shown. What is the probable diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Placenta accrete syndrome involves abnormal placental adherence to the uterine wall, often leading to severe bleeding during delivery and requiring obstetric hysterectomy.

questions.text: Components of Disaster cycle that can be included in the recovery phase are: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Response – Rehabilitation – Reconstruction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The recovery phase of the disaster cycle includes the components of Response, Rehabilitation, and Reconstruction, which are essential for restoring the community post-disaster.

questions.text: Identify the stage of the pressure sore: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Stage 4 pressure sores are the most advanced, involving full-thickness tissue loss with visible bone, muscle, or tendon. Early identification and treatment of pressure sores can prevent progression to this severe stage.

questions.text: A mother brought her 2-year-old child to the OPD with complaints of lack of weight gain, abdominal pain on eating, and poor eating habits. The child was advised to follow a gluten-free diet, after which there was an improvement in the general condition and weight gain. What is the probable diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Celiac disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Celiac disease should be suspected in patients with symptoms of gastrointestinal distress, poor weight gain, and improvement upon adopting a gluten-free diet.

questions.text: A 23-year-old woman with eclampsia is on a maintenance dose of MgSO₄. When will you stop MgSO₄? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Urine output 60ml in 4hr

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ MgSO₄ should be stopped if the patient’s urine output is less than 30 ml per hour (or 60 ml in 4 hours), as this indicates poor excretion and risk of magnesium toxicity.

questions.text: Patient can see 3 green dots on the Worth’s 4 dots test. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Seeing three green dots on the Worth 4-dot test indicates right eye suppression (RE suppression), as the right eye is not seeing the red dot.

questions.text: A 1-month-old baby presents with an olive-shaped mass and recurrent vomiting. An ultrasound (USG) was performed, as shown below. What is your diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) CHPS (Congenital Hypertrophic Pyloric Stenosis)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ CHPS should be suspected in infants presenting with non-bilious projectile vomiting, an olive-shaped abdominal mass, and confirmed with ultrasound showing pyloric muscle thickening and elongation (typically 4 mm thickness and 16 mm length)

questions.text: A study was undertaken to estimate the effect of a drug ‘D’ in three different groups – Plants, Animals, and Human beings. Samples were chosen randomly out of the three groups individually. This is a type of? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Stratified random sampling

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Stratified random sampling involves dividing a heterogeneous population into homogeneous subgroups and then conducting random sampling within each subgroup.

questions.text: A 28-year-old G5L4 with all 4-girl children presents at 18 weeks and asks for the sex of the child on ultrasound. This is her first antenatal visit. What should be done? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Do ultrasound for gestational age, check for abnormalities, check sex, and tell the mother.

options.label: B
options.text: Do ultrasound for gestational age, check for abnormalities, check sex but don’t tell the mother.

options.label: C
options.text: Do ultrasound for gestational age, check for abnormalities, don’t check the sex.

options.label: D
options.text: Don’t do ultrasound, do ANC only.

questions.correct_answer: C. Do ultrasound for gestational age, check for abnormalities, don’t check the sex.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Do ultrasound for gestational age, check for abnormalities, don’t check the sex.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The key point to remember is that checking or revealing the sex of the fetus during an ultrasound is illegal under the PCPNDT Act. The ultrasound should only be used for assessing fetal gestational age and abnormalities.

questions.text: A male present with grouped painful vesicular lesions in the genital area. History of multiple sexual partners present. Irregular use of condoms history present. Smear showed MNGCs. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Herpes genitalis should be considered when a patient presents with grouped painful vesicular lesions in the genital area, especially when there is a history of risky sexual behavior and multinucleated giant cells are observed on a smear.

questions.text: Which one of the following is incorrect about iron transport? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Iron is converted from ferrous to ferric form before absorption through apical membrane.

options.label: C
options.text: Iron is transported via transferrin in the blood.

options.label: D
options.text: Ascorbic acid helps in iron reabsorption.

questions.correct_answer: A. Iron is converted from ferrous to ferric form before absorption through apical membrane.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Iron is converted from ferrous to ferric form before absorption through apical membrane.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Iron must be converted from ferric (Fe3+) to ferrous (Fe2+) form for effective absorption through the apical membrane of enterocytes
