questions.text: A patient has multiple tendon xanthomas. Serum cholesterol (398 mg/dL) and LDL 220 mg/dL were found to be raised. What is the defect? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) LDL receptors defect

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ LDL receptor defects cause familial hypercholesterolemia, characterized by elevated LDL, cholesterol levels, and tendon xanthomas.

questions.text: Which of the following is the likely diagnosis in a patient with the image of chromosome 15 represented here? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Prader-Willi syndrome is caused by a deletion on the paternal chromosome 15q11-q13 or by maternal uniparental disomy, and is characterized by obesity due to hyperphagia, intellectual disability, and specific behavioral traits.

questions.text: In the below question mechanical receptors are given with their functions. Choose the correctly matched pair.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Pacinian corpuscle - Fast Vibration

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pacinian corpuscles are responsible for detecting fast vibrations, and Ruffini endings detect skin stretch.

questions.text: A 25-year-old woman whose last delivery was 5 years back presents with secondary amenorrhea of 2 years. She does not bleed on giving estrogen and progesterone. A laparoscopy shows the following. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Genital TB

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Genital tuberculosis can cause chronic endometritis and endometrial destruction, leading to secondary amenorrhea and absence of withdrawal bleeding on hormone administration, with characteristic whitish caseating lesions visible on laparoscopy.

questions.text: Calculate the median from the given set of observations: 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 4, 8. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For an even number of observations, the median is the average of the two middle values when the data set is arranged in ascending order.

questions.text: 18-year-old female presented with high fever and pain in knee and ankle joints. On examination, the patient had a pan-systolic murmur at the apex. Rheumatoid factor is negative. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Acute rheumatic fever is diagnosed when a young patient presents with fever, migratory arthritis, and carditis, often leading to mitral valve involvement, characterized by a murmur indicative of mitral regurgitation.

questions.text: A female singer with hoarseness of voice, unable to sing higher frequency notes. Bowed and depressed unilateral vocal cord is seen. Which muscle is involved? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Cricothyroid

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The cricothyroid muscle is essential for producing high-frequency notes by tensing the vocal cords. Paralysis of the cricothyroid muscle leads to the inability to produce these higher notes due to a lack of tension in the vocal cords.

questions.text: Which of these is used for immediate reversal of Vecuronium in a patient for normal kidney function? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)Sugammadex

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sugammadex is the drug of choice for the immediate reversal of vecuronium-induced neuromuscular blockade

questions.text: The given instrument is used for: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.  D) Low air velocity

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Kata thermometer is primarily used today to assess low air velocity.

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman with a history of cervical erosion and spotting since 2 months. What is the next best step? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)  LBC + HPV + cervical biopsy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For a patient with cervical erosion and spotting, the best approach is to screen for cervical cancer with LBC, HPV testing, and a cervical biopsy if indicated.

questions.text: Which of the following cardioselective beta-blockers has been shown to decrease mortality in patients with congestive heart failure? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Bisoprolol

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bisoprolol is a cardioselective beta-blocker that has been shown to decrease mortality in patients with chronic congestive heart failure.

questions.text: Identify the level of amputation: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Below Knee

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a below knee amputation, both the tibia and fibula bones are visible, distinguishing it from above knee and foot-level amputations like Lis Franc and Chopart.

questions.text: Image of a patient with large ulcerated breast cancer with liver metastasis. What is the management? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Simple mastectomy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In patients with stage IV breast cancer with distant metastasis, such as liver metastasis, the primary focus is on palliation. Simple mastectomy may be performed to manage symptoms from a large ulcerated tumor, but more extensive surgeries or curative approaches are not indicated.

questions.text: A 53-year-old male patient who is a known case of COPD developed breathlessness and is on mechanical ventilation. He suddenly developed hypoxia, and on examination, he has reduced/absent breath sounds on the left hemithorax with increased peak inspiratory pressure. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pneumothorax should be considered in ventilated patients with sudden respiratory deterioration, absent breath sounds on one side, and increased peak inspiratory pressure.

questions.text: HDI is calculated by using ? (NEET PG 2024) Life expectancy at birth Mean years of schooling Gross national product
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) All three

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HDI is calculated using three components: life expectancy at birth, mean years of schooling, and Gross National Income per capita. These factors represent health, education, and living standards, respectively.
  • ➤ HDI range – 0 to +1 HDI (India) – 0.644 (Rank 134) HDI (Switzerland) – 0.96 (Rank 1)

  • ➤ HDI (India) – 0.644 (Rank 134)
  • ➤ HDI (India) – 0.644 (Rank 134)
  • ➤ HDI (Switzerland) – 0.96 (Rank 1)
  • ➤ HDI (Switzerland) – 0.96 (Rank 1)

questions.text: A patient presents with headaches, confusion, and has recently been diagnosed with a brain tumor. MRI of the brain revealed a cerebellar mass. The family history reveals occurrences of both brain and kidney tumors. Which of the following conditions is most likely associated with this clinical presentation? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Von Hippel-Lindau syndrome is associated with cerebellar hemangioblastomas and renal cell carcinoma, especially in the context of familial occurrences. Recognizing the combination of brain and kidney tumors should prompt consideration of VHL.

questions.text: A Patient presented with a growth on the penis, which was diagnosed as a T3 cancer without lymph node metastasis. What is the management? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: B
options.text: Penectomy with bilateral superficial inguinal dissection

questions.correct_answer: C. Penectomy with bilateral ilio-inguinal dissection
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Penectomy with bilateral ilio-inguinal dissection

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For T3 penile cancer without lymph node metastasis, the standard management is penectomy along with ilio-inguinal lymph node dissection to address both the primary tumor and potential regional spread.

questions.text: A patient presents with neck swelling and undergoes a tissue biopsy which reveals the cells as shown in the image. Which of the following is the likely gene affected in this patient? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) BRAF gene

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma often presents with cells that have optically clear cytoplasm, and this type of cancer is frequently associated with BRAF gene mutations, especially in the tall cell variant which is more aggressive.

questions.text: A 6-year-old child presenting with recurrent respiratory infections. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) CPAM

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ CPAM is characterized by multiple cystic, air-filled spaces in the lung and is a congenital lesion that often presents with recurrent respiratory infections.

questions.text: What would be the mode of delivery in images 1 and 2? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Image 1: Vaginal; image 2: Cesarean

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In twin pregnancies, the mode of delivery is determined primarily by the presentation of the first twin. If the first twin is cephalic, vaginal delivery can be considered, but if the first twin is non-cephalic (e.g., breech), a cesarean section is generally recommended.

questions.text: Giving TPN (total para-enteral nutrition) in a patient in ICU with metabolic syndrome predisposes to: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Hyperglycemia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In patients with metabolic syndrome, TPN can exacerbate hyperglycemia due to pre-existing insulin resistance. This underscores the need for careful monitoring of blood glucose levels and management of insulin requirements in these patients.

questions.text: Identify the structures in the given image. (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: A – Apocrine sweat gland, B – Arrector pilorum, C – Eccrine sweat gland, D – Sebaceous gland

options.label: B
options.text: A – Arrector pilorum, B – Apocrine sweat gland, C – Eccrine sweat gland, D – Sebaceous gland

options.label: C
options.text: A – Sebaceous gland, B – Eccrine sweat gland, C – Arrector pilorum, D – Apocrine sweat gland

options.label: D
options.text: A – Eccrine sweat gland, B – Arrector pilorum, C – Sebaceous gland, D – Apocrine sweat gland

questions.correct_answer: D. A – Eccrine sweat gland, B – Arrector pilorum, C – Sebaceous gland, D – Apocrine sweat gland
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Eccrine sweat glands are located closer to the skin surface, arrector pilorum is a small muscle connected to hair follicles, sebaceous glands produce sebum and are linked to hair follicles, while apocrine sweat glands are deeper and secrete a thicker fluid associated with hair follicles.

questions.text: A mother delivers a 2.5 kg baby with normal vaginal delivery in a rural area. Which of the following is an incorrect statement? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: B
options.text: Bath the baby with warm water immediately

questions.correct_answer: B. Bath the baby with warm water immediately
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bathing a newborn immediately after birth is not recommended; it should be delayed until the umbilical cord falls off, and gentle sponging should be started after 24 hours to maintain hygiene and prevent hypothermia.

questions.text: Identify the part of the cochlear implant marked? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Grounding electrode

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The grounding electrode or reference electrode in a cochlear implant is implanted in the temporalis area and is crucial for accurate signal transmission by providing a reference point for electrical signals.

questions.text: A 21-year-old patient presented with weakness and fatigue. His BP was 80/60 mm Hg and his reports showed a serum Na+ of 127 mEq/L and serum K+ of 5.2 mEq/L. On examination, the patient had hyperpigmentation in the knuckles, arms, and legs. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Primary adrenal insufficiency

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Primary adrenal insufficiency (Addison's disease) presents with hypotension, hyponatremia, hyperkalemia, and hyperpigmentation due to low cortisol and aldosterone levels.

questions.text: What is the best test to diagnose Wilson’s disease? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hepatic copper estimation via liver biopsy is the gold standard test for diagnosing Wilson’s disease, providing a direct measure of copper accumulation in the liver.

questions.text: Injury to which nerve results in absent gag reflex? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) IX & X

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The gag reflex involves the Glossopharyngeal nerve (CN IX) for sensory input and the Vagus nerve (CN X) for motor response. Damage to either nerve can result in an absent gag reflex.

questions.text: Identify the blocked structure. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The maxillary sinus can be blocked by an antrochoanal polyp that extends into the nasal cavity through the middle meatus.

questions.text: A 20-year-old sexual assault victim was examined in court "in camera." What does it imply? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Closed proceeding

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ "In camera" refers to a closed proceeding in court where only selected individuals are allowed to be present, ensuring the privacy of sensitive cases such as those involving sexual assault.

questions.text: Preferable time for IUCD insertion in a 28-year-old woman who has just delivered a healthy newborn. It was a normal vaginal delivery. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Up to 48 hours

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The most preferable time for IUCD insertion after a normal vaginal delivery is within the first 48 hours postpartum to take advantage of the naturally dilated cervix and minimize expulsion risk

questions.text: A 25-year-old patient presents with a history of recurrent sinusitis, bronchiectasis, and chronic cough. He also mentions that he has had several ear infections and episodes of pneumonia over the past few years. On physical examination, you note digital clubbing. A chest X-ray is obtained. What is the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Kartagener syndrome

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Kartagener syndrome is characterized by the triad of situs inversus, chronic sinusitis, and bronchiectasis.

questions.text: What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Anencephaly is diagnosed by the absence of cranial bones and brain tissue on ultrasound, often accompanied by the "frog eye sign."

questions.text: A patient presents with gradual loss of night vision and peripheral vision. Which of the following conditions is most likely responsible for these symptoms according to the given fundoscopic image? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Retinitis Pigmentosa

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Retinitis Pigmentosa is identified by a triad of symptoms: black pigmentary deposits, vascular attenuation, and waxy pallor of the optic disc, accompanied by nyctalopia and tunnel vision.

questions.text: Which artery is used for AV shunting with the great saphenous vein for hemodialysis and is present behind the medial malleolus and 2.5 cm in front of the tendon calcaneus? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Posterior tibial artery

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The posterior tibial artery is the artery located behind the medial malleolus and is commonly used for AV shunting with the great saphenous vein in procedures like hemodialysis access due to its superficial location and ease of access.
  • ➤ posterior tibial artery

questions.text: Observe the image below showing different food items. Identify the source of Thiamine. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) B (Rice)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Rice, especially in its whole or unpolished form, is a significant dietary source of thiamine (Vitamin B1).
  • ➤ Rice, especially in its whole or unpolished form, is a significant dietary source of thiamine (Vitamin B1).
  • ➤ Other sources – Whole cereal, meat, fish, legumes, ground nut.
  • ➤ Other sources

questions.text: A female patient presented with symptomatic urinary symptoms. On laboratory examination, growth of coagulase negative novobiocin-resistant Staphylococcus with >10⁴ colony growth is seen. What is the true statement regarding this? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.correct_answer: D. Consider it as a UTI
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Consider it as a UTI

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ When a female patient presents with symptomatic urinary symptoms and lab findings show coagulase-negative, novobiocin-resistant Staphylococcus with significant colony growth, it should be considered as a UTI and treated accordingly.

questions.text: A woman at 8 weeks of gestation is diagnosed with hyperthyroidism. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment option? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Propylthiouracil

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the first trimester of pregnancy, Propylthiouracil (PTU) is the preferred treatment for hyperthyroidism due to its lower teratogenic risk compared to other antithyroid drugs.

questions.text: A patient is being treated with phenobarbitone. Which of the following is inhibited? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Complex I → coenzyme Q

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Phenobarbitone specifically inhibits the electron transport between Complex I and coenzyme Q, disrupting ATP production.

questions.text: A 27-year-old male came with complaints of asymptomatic generalized papulosquamous rash on trunk, moist flat grey perianal lesions and hair loss as given below. What is the most likely causative organism? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Treponema pallidum

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The "moth-eaten alopecia" is a key diagnostic feature of secondary syphilis, and Treponema pallidum is the causative organism.

questions.text: Diagnosis the condition. (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Bladder exstrophy is a congenital condition where the bladder is exposed outside the abdomen, often accompanied by genital and pelvic abnormalities.

questions.text: Which of the following is commonly used for maintenance therapy in opioid abuse? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Buprenorphine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Methadone and buprenorphine are long-acting opioids used for maintenance therapy in opioid addiction. They replace the addictive opioid to prevent withdrawal symptoms. To treat withdrawal symptoms: Diazepam (a benzodiazepine) is used for seizures. Clonidine or beta blockers are used for sympathetic symptoms. Naltrexone is used to prevent relapse in opioid addiction.
  • ➤ Methadone and buprenorphine are long-acting opioids used for maintenance therapy in opioid addiction. They replace the addictive opioid to prevent withdrawal symptoms.
  • ➤ Methadone
  • ➤ buprenorphine
  • ➤ To treat withdrawal symptoms: Diazepam (a benzodiazepine) is used for seizures. Clonidine or beta blockers are used for sympathetic symptoms.
  • ➤ Diazepam (a benzodiazepine) is used for seizures. Clonidine or beta blockers are used for sympathetic symptoms.
  • ➤ Diazepam (a benzodiazepine) is used for seizures.
  • ➤ Diazepam
  • ➤ Clonidine or beta blockers are used for sympathetic symptoms.
  • ➤ Clonidine
  • ➤ Naltrexone is used to prevent relapse in opioid addiction.
  • ➤ Naltrexone

questions.text: What is the mechanism of action of aprepitant? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Aprepitant is an NK1 receptor antagonist used in preventing chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting by blocking the action of substance P.

questions.text: An athlete collapsed suddenly and dies. He had an abnormal septal thickening. His sibling also expired due to a cardiac condition earlier. His cardiac biopsy image is shown. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy is characterized by asymmetrical septal hypertrophy, disorganized cardiac muscle fibers, and is commonly associated with sudden death in young athletes, particularly during exertion.

questions.text: A 2-year-old child is undergoing CPR. He is pulseless and shows the below ECG. What is the next step? (NEET PG 2024)

options.label: A
options.text: Give shock with 2 J/kg and check pulse

options.label: B
options.text: Give shock with 2 J/kg and continue CPR for 2 mins

options.label: D
options.text: Continue CPR till pulse is back

questions.correct_answer: B. Give shock with 2 J/kg and continue CPR for 2 mins
questions.explanation:
Ans. B)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ In a pediatric cardiac arrest with pulseless ventricular tachycardia on the ECG, the correct immediate action is to defibrillate with 2 J/kg and continue CPR for 2 minutes before reassessing.

questions.text: A child presented with intellectual disability and hepatosplenomegaly. Bone marrow biopsy showed a “crumpled paper appearance.” What is your best diagnosis? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Glucocerebrosidase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The "crumpled paper appearance" in bone marrow cells is a hallmark of Gaucher disease, caused by a deficiency of the enzyme glucocerebrosidase.

questions.text: A 58-year-old individual presents to the emergency department with symptoms of high fever, chills, and a cough producing greenish sputum. Vital signs include a blood pressure of 150/90 mmHg, pulse rate of 108 bpm, respiratory rate of 20 breaths per minute, and an oxygen saturation of 89% on room air. The patient's chest X-ray is displayed below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Community-acquired pneumonia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Community-acquired pneumonia is present with acute onset symptoms such as fever, productive cough, and chills, along with radiographic evidence showing lobar consolidation or interstitial infiltrates, and it requires prompt antibiotic treatment based on culture results to manage the infection effectively.

questions.text: A man presented to the emergency department following a road traffic accident with complaints of chest pain and difficulty breathing. An X-ray was taken and is displayed below. Based on the findings, which type of breathing pattern is most likely observed in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Paradoxical respiration

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Paradoxical respiration is a key clinical indicator of flail chest, resulting from severe chest trauma with multiple rib fractures causing a segment of the chest wall to move independently. This condition presents significant management challenges, necessitating interventions like oxygen administration, pain management, and potentially more aggressive respiratory support.

questions.text: A male patient presents with a history of urinary tract infection (UTI), suspected to be caused by bacterial infection. Which of the following structures is utilized by bacteria for adherence to the urinary tract?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Fimbriae

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fimbriae are used for adherence to host cells, particularly in the context of urinary tract infections. Their presence allows bacteria to establish infection by resisting the natural defense mechanisms of the host, such as urine flow in the urinary tract.

questions.text: What mechanism occurs within the zona pellucida of an oocyte to prevent the entry of multiple sperm cells after the initial fertilization?

options.label: B
options.text: Increased membrane potential of the oocyte

options.label: D
options.text: Decreased membrane potential of the oocyte

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Cortical reaction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The cortical reaction is essential, as it is the primary defense against polyspermy, ensuring that only one sperm fertilizes the oocyte, thereby maintaining the correct genetic composition of the embryo.

questions.text: A patient with a long-term central intravenous line, currently on antibiotics, develops a fever. Blood cultures indicate the presence of Staphylococcus epidermidis and biofilm formation on the catheter. What is the significance of the biofilm in terms of antibiotic resistance?

options.label: B
options.text: Biofilm offers resistance, necessitating removal of the catheter

options.label: C
options.text: Biofilm does not affect antibiotic susceptibility

options.label: D
options.text: Biofilm can be washed off from the catheter

questions.correct_answer: B. Biofilm offers resistance, necessitating removal of the catheter
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Biofilm offers resistance, necessitating removal of the catheter

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Biofilms confer significant antibiotic resistance to bacteria colonizing indwelling medical devices. The standard response when biofilms are suspected involves the removal of the device to prevent further complications and to manage the infection effectively.

questions.text: What biological growth patterns are represented by each curve in the following graph, tracking development from birth to 20 years?

options.label: D
options.text: 1 - Brain, 2 - Waldeyer's ring, 3 - Somatic growth, 4 - Testicular growth

questions.correct_answer: D. 1 - Brain, 2 - Waldeyer's ring, 3 - Somatic growth, 4 - Testicular growth
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 1 - Brain, 2 - Waldeyer's ring, 3 - Somatic growth, 4 - Testicular growth

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The distinct growth patterns for specific organs and tissues: Brain growth is rapid and completes early by age 2, Waldeyer's ring (including tonsils) peaks between ages 4 and 8, somatic growth follows a sigmoid pattern with a puberty spike, and testicular growth begins its significant increase at puberty.

questions.text: Match the nerve supply to the respective regions of the external ear as shown in the image:

options.label: A
options.text: A - Auriculotemporal nerve; B - Greater auricular nerve; C - Facial and Vagus nerve

options.label: B
options.text: A - Greater auricular nerve; B - Auriculotemporal nerve; C - Facial and Vagus nerve

options.label: C
options.text: A - Greater auricular nerve; B - Facial and Vagus nerve; C - Auriculotemporal nerve

options.label: D
options.text: A - Facial and Vagus nerve; B - Greater auricular nerve; C - Auriculotemporal nerve

questions.correct_answer: B. A - Greater auricular nerve; B - Auriculotemporal nerve; C - Facial and Vagus nerve
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) A - Greater auricular nerve; B - Auriculotemporal nerve; C - Facial and Vagus nerve

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Nerve supply of Pinna

questions.text: Based on the constituents shown on the IV fluid bag, identify the fluid typically given to post-operative patients.
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Ringer lactate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ For post-operative care, Ringer lactate is the preferred IV fluid due to its balanced electrolyte composition that mimics the body's plasma, making it ideal for managing fluid and electrolyte balance after surgery.

questions.text: A 21-year-old female complains of fever, headache, and vomiting for the past 3 days. She has been residing at an army recruitment camp for the last three weeks. During an examination, she displays neck stiffness and a maculopapular rash over the trunk and extremities. Which of the following statements is false about the disease she is likely suffering from?

options.label: A
options.text: Carriers of this disease can be treated with Rifampicin.

options.label: B
options.text: It can lead to adrenal hemorrhage.

options.label: C
options.text: Terminal complement deficiency increases the risk of this disease.

options.label: D
options.text: Metronidazole is the drug of choice.

questions.correct_answer: D. Metronidazole is the drug of choice.
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Metronidazole is the drug of choice.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Meningococcal meningitis should be treated with a third-generation cephalosporin like ceftriaxone, not Metronidazole, which is not effective against Neisseria meningitidis . Awareness of correct treatment options is crucial for effective management and improved outcomes in patients suspected of having meningococcal meningitis.

questions.text: A CT scan of a patient with a hydatid cyst is shown below. What is the type of hydatid cyst as per the Gharbi classification?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Type 2

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The "Water Lily" sign is seen in Type 2 hydatid cysts as per the Gharbi classification, caused by detachment of the endocyst membrane, leading to floating membranes within the cyst.
